Ingredients.4: 1 small red bell pepper - cored, seeded, and chopped

Ingredients.9: 1 (15.25 ounce) can black bean chili (such as Amy's®)

Ingredients.11: 0.25 cup chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste

Ingredients.15: 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste

Directions.1: Place cashews in a bowl and cover with cold water. Soak for 4 hours. Drain.

Directions.2: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.

Directions.3: Combine drained cashews, salsa, bell pepper, nutritional yeast, turmeric, and 1 teaspoon salt in a high-speed blender; blend until smooth and slightly warm.

Directions.4: Spread tortilla chips on the prepared baking sheet. Spoon chili all over chips and spoon cashew nacho cheese over chili.

Directions.5: Bake in the preheated oven until hot, 10 to 15 minutes.

Directions.6: Meanwhile, place avocados, 1/4 cup cilantro, and lime juice in a bowl. Season with salt and mash with a fork until guacamole is mostly smooth but a little chunky.

Directions.7: Top nachos with guacamole and pico de gallo, and sprinkle with cilantro. Serve hot.
